torch_geometric.profileÔÉÅ

profileit

A decorator to facilitate profiling a function, e.g., obtaining training runtime and memory statistics of a specific model on a specific dataset.

A context decorator to facilitate timing a function, e.g., obtaining the runtime of a specific model on a specific dataset.

Creates a summary of collected runtime and memory statistics.

Given a torch.nn.Module, count its trainable parameters.

Given a torch.nn.Module, get its actual disk size in bytes.

get_data_size

Given a torch_geometric.data.Data object, get its theoretical memory usage in bytes.

get_cpu_memory_from_gc

Returns the used CPU memory in bytes, as reported by the Python garbage collector.

get_gpu_memory_from_gc

Returns the used GPU memory in bytes, as reported by the Python garbage collector.

get_gpu_memory_from_nvidia_smi

Returns the free and used GPU memory in megabytes, as reported by nivdia-smi.

benchmark

Benchmark a list of functions funcs that receive the same set of arguments args.

GNN profiling package.

profileit()[source]ÔÉÅ

A decorator to facilitate profiling a function, e.g., obtaining training runtime and memory statistics of a specific model on a specific dataset. Returns a Stats object with the attributes time, max_active_cuda, max_reserved_cuda, max_active_cuda, nvidia_smi_free_cuda, nvidia_smi_used_cuda.

@profileit()
def train(model, optimizer, x, edge_index, y):
    optimizer.zero_grad()
    out = model(x, edge_index)
    loss = criterion(out, y)
    loss.backward()
    optimizer.step()
    return float(loss)

loss, stats = train(model, x, edge_index, y)
class timeit(log: bool = True, avg_time_divisor: int = 0)[source]ÔÉÅ

A context decorator to facilitate timing a function, e.g., obtaining the runtime of a specific model on a specific dataset.

@torch.no_grad()
def test(model, x, edge_index):
    return model(x, edge_index)

with timeit() as t:
    z = test(model, x, edge_index)
time = t.duration
Parameters:

  • log (bool, optional) ‚Äì If set to False, will not log any runtime to the console. (default: True)

  • avg_time_divisor (int, optional) ‚Äì If set to a value greater than 1, will divide the total time by this value. Useful for calculating the average of runtimes within a for-loop. (default: 0)

reset()[source]ÔÉÅ

Prints the duration and resets current timer.

get_stats_summary(stats_list: List[Stats])[source]ÔÉÅ

Creates a summary of collected runtime and memory statistics. Returns a StatsSummary object with the attributes time_mean, time_std, max_active_cuda, max_reserved_cuda, max_active_cuda, min_nvidia_smi_free_cuda, max_nvidia_smi_used_cuda.

Parameters:

stats_list (List[Stats]) ‚Äì A list of Stats objects, as returned by profileit().

Given a torch_geometric.data.Data object, get its theoretical memory usage in bytes.

get_cpu_memory_from_gc() → int[source]ÔÉÅ

Returns the used CPU memory in bytes, as reported by the Python garbage collector.

get_gpu_memory_from_gc(device: int = 0) → int[source]ÔÉÅ

Returns the used GPU memory in bytes, as reported by the Python garbage collector.

Parameters:

device (int, optional) ‚Äì The GPU device identifier. (default: 1)

get_gpu_memory_from_nvidia_smi(device: int = 0, digits: int = 2) → Tuple[float, float][source]ÔÉÅ

Returns the free and used GPU memory in megabytes, as reported by nivdia-smi.

Note

nvidia-smi will generally overestimate the amount of memory used by the actual program, see here.

Parameters:

  • device (int, optional) ‚Äì The GPU device identifier. (default: 1)

  • digits (int) ‚Äì The number of decimals to use for megabytes. (default: 2)

benchmark(funcs: List[Callable], args: Union[Tuple[Any], List[Tuple[Any]]], num_steps: int, func_names: Optional[List[str]] = None, num_warmups: int = 10, backward: bool = False, per_step: bool = False, progress_bar: bool = False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Benchmark a list of functions funcs that receive the same set of arguments args.

Parameters:

  • funcs ([Callable]) ‚Äì The list of functions to benchmark.

  • args ((Any, ) or [(Any, )]) ‚Äì The arguments to pass to the functions. Can be a list of arguments for each function in funcs in case their headers differ. Alternatively, you can pass in functions that generate arguments on-the-fly (e.g., useful for benchmarking models on various sizes).

  • num_steps (int) ‚Äì The number of steps to run the benchmark.

  • func_names ([str], optional) ‚Äì The names of the functions. If not given, will try to infer the name from the function itself. (default: None)

  • num_warmups (int, optional) ‚Äì The number of warmup steps. (default: 10)

  • backward (bool, optional) ‚Äì If set to True, will benchmark both forward and backward passes. (default: False)

  • per_step (bool, optional) ‚Äì If set to True, will report runtimes per step. (default: False)

  • progress_bar (bool, optional) ‚Äì If set to True, will print a progress bar during benchmarking. (default: False)
